meanings.definition: To replenish or supply with new stock.
meanings.sent1: I need to restock my fridge with fresh groceries.
meanings.sent2: After selling out, the store had to restock its shelves quickly.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to restock the pantry before the big event to avoid a cooking disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to restock the warmth in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The rain helped restock the dried-up river, bringing life back to the land.

meanings.sent1: Don't forget to restock the bird feeder with seeds.
meanings.sent2: The gas station needs to restock its fuel supply regularly.
meanings.sent3: The kids raced to restock their candy stash after Halloween.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can restock the joy in a weary soul.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creativity seemed to restock endlessly, flowing onto the canvas.

meanings.sent1: The bookstore will restock the bestsellers section tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse workers restock the shelves with new products every morning.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to restock his disappearing rabbit trick for the next show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could restock the happiness in a room full of frowns.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's hands worked tirelessly to restock the flowerbed with colorful blooms.
